THOMAS JANN, alias JANE, installatus 1497. Coll. Regalis Cantabrig.Hoc in loco errat Frithus noster, socius enim fuit Jann Collegii Novi Oxoniensis. Socius, decretorum D. Episcopus Norwic. consecr. 1499. & obiit infra AnnumVide Libr. intit. The Antiquities of the Cathedral Church of Norwich, pag. 2, 25, 37. & in Ecclesia sua Cathedrali sepultus est.
JOHANNES ESTERFIELD installatus 1498.
THOMAS HOBBES installatus 1498. postea Decanus decimus octavus 1507.
GULIELMUS BUTTLER, Benefactor, (cujus ob∣celebratus 2 Apr.) installatus fuit 1499.
RICHARDUS PAYNE installatus 1499.
GULIELMUS ATTWATER, Vice-Cancell. Oxon. hoc Anno & sequentibus, Etonensis Coll. Socius, installatus hic 1499. ad Episcopatum Linc. pro∣motus 1514. obiit 1520.
GULIELMUS ATKINSON, S. T. D. obiit 8 Aug. 1509. & Windsorae sepultusVide page 128. ubi fuit instal∣latus 1501.
GALFREDUS SIMEON, Coll. Novi Qxon. instal∣latus 1504.
ROGERUS LUPTON, Collegii Regalis Cant. So∣cius L. L. D. Praepositus Etonensis, Rector Ec∣clesiae de Hasely in Oxon. quam resignavit 1525. ob. 1540. hic installatus 1504.
ROBERTUS HONYWOOD, L. L. D. Coll. Omn. Anm. Socius, electus 1486. & hic & illie Bene∣factor, installatus 1506. & Archi-Diaconus de Taunton, obiit 1522. &Vide pag. 150. sepultus Windsorae.
RICHARDUS RAWLINS, Socius Coll. Merton, installatus 1506.
JOHANNES OXENBRIDGE, inter Canonicos installatus 1509, & Benefactor praecipuus, cujus obitus celebr. Julii 25.

JACOBUS DENTON, Coll. Regal. Cantab. Soc. L. L. D. Decanus Lichfeldensis, Consiliarius, Re∣gius hic installatus 1510. novas Communias pro Contaristis & Choristis hujus Collegii funda∣vit, summamque 489 l. 7 s. 1 d. expendit in aedi∣ficiis construendis ac utensilibus una cum terris & tenementis quibusdam procurandis pro funda∣tione praedicta, praeter alia ejus pia opera tum hic Windsorae, tum illic Leichfeildae peracta; obiit 1532. [Hoc Anno Tho. Wolsey, factus erat Ca∣nonicus, ut in Patent. 21 Hen. 8. p. 3.] sed post dissolutionem generalem omnium Cantariarum, dissolutio etiam praedictarum Communiarum se∣cuta est. Redditus vero & proventus usui prae∣dicta assignati in augmentationem stipendiorum Minorum Canonicorum per Decanum & Cano∣nioos applicantur & per Sub-Praecentorem reci∣piuntur. Decano interim & Canonicis dictas
terras ab omni titulo Regio non minima pecu∣niarum summa redimentibus.

JOHANNES CHAMBER,Viri hujusce imaginem ab Holbenio depictam, are & aqua forti expressit celeberrimus Wenceslaus Hollar Bohemus. Coll. Merton, Oxon. Soc. installatus 1510. M. D. Medicus Regius, cum Linacro & Victorio Collegii Medicorum Lond. fundator, Collegii St. Stephani Westmonast. in dissolutione ejusdem Decanus; cui Collegio terras quasdem donavit, quas postea manu Re∣gia apprehensas, ipse in vivis conspiciebat. Iste Chamberus a Godwyno Londavensi in Commentario suo de Praesulibus Angliae pro ultimo Abbate & primo Episcopo Petroburgensi, An. 1541. con∣secrato habebatur, sed hallucinatus est Landa∣vensis, Johannes enim Chambers noster, qui & Medicus Regius fuit, &c. nedum Canonicus hic sine aliquo Episcopali titulo usque ad mor∣tem permansit, sed residens etiam ut plurimum adfuit, & quandoque propter personale obse∣quium Regiae Majestati praestandum, secum dispensatum fuit pro absentia.Vide pag. 145. Obiit demum [Chambero Episcopo Petroburgensi adhuc super∣stites] Ann. 1549. & in hac Capella de Wind∣sore est sepultus.
ROBERTUS BECONSAW, installatus 1512. & obiit 1525.
CHRISTOPHERUS PLUMMER installatus 1513. & per attincturam deprivatus 1536.
GALFRIDUS WRENN installatus 1515. obiit 1527. & sepultus Windsorae, Benefactor cujus obitus celebratus est 4 Aprilis.

JACOBUS MALLET, S. T. D. installatus 1516. Mag. Hospitalis S. Aegidii in Wy∣comb Magna in Bucks, dictumque Hospitale in manus Collegii resignavit, pensione annua de 40 Sol. pro termina vitae suae sibi reservata. De alta proditione attinctus (sic enim in Charta Regia Successoris sui habetur) morte mulctatus est 1543. & Cole successit. Proditio ejus (uti fert traditio) hujusmodi erat. In Dissolutione Monasteriorum magna & periculosa suborta est subito per diversas hujus Regni provincias, po∣pularis Commotio. Dumque hujus rei novitas huc annunciatur quidem ex hospitibus quos an∣nosus iste senex invitasset, hoc inter pranden∣dum retulit cui senex Adagium illud Anglica∣num (dolens etiam ut dicitur) subjecit; Then hath the King brought his Hogs to a fair Market. An aliquid unquam tale crimen (si modo crimen) tali fuit dignum poena? nisi saltem subtyranno illo, de cujus regimine si quis elogium illud Rawleanum veriloquium fuisse affirmabit, haud ego inficias ibo, vir si exquisitissimum exemplar exquisitissi∣mae Tyrannidis quisquam prae se haberer, Cha∣racterem illium inspiciat.
RICHARDUS SIDNORE, S. T. D. installatus 1518. Archi-Diaconus de Totness, Scriba Or∣dinis Garterii constitutus 1524. obiit 1534.
JOHANNES LONGLAND, Coll. Magd. Oxon. Socius S. T. D. installatus 1519. Confessor Regius, ad Episcoparum Lyncoln. promotus 1521. ob. 1547. & sepultus est Etonae.

THOMAS MAGNUS, S. T. P. installatus 1520. infans expositus Newarci super Trentam in∣deque dictam, Thomas Among us. Postea vero quam plurimis beneficiis ditatus, rite est Mag∣nus
resignavit 1547. [This Dr. Magnus was sent to Scotland in Sept. 1524. to be the King's Agent there to procure his Business and to encline the young King's Mind to∣wards him; as also to give Intelligence. His Arms are Bendy of 6 Gules and Vert. on a Fess Or, a Lion Rampant between 2 Cinquefoiles, purpure.]
GULIELMUS CLYFTON, Decret. Dr. installa∣tus 1520. Ecclesiae de West Ildesley in Berks Rector, Capellanus Regius. Obiit 1541.
RICHARDUS RAWSON, S. T. D. installatus 1521. & Archi-Diaconus Essex. Obiit 1543.
GULIELMUS TATE, L. L. D. installatus 1522. & obiit 1540.
MILO WELLES, installatus 16 Februarii, 1525. loco Beconsau, deprivatus 1535.
ROBERTUS SHERTON, S. T. P. installatus 8 Aprilis 1525. loco Wrenn, Catherinae Reginae Elee∣mosynarius, Collegii S. Johannis Cantabr. Ma∣gister. Aulae S. Catherinae ibidem Benefactor. Obiit 1535.

RICHARDUS WOLMAN, L. L. D. installatus 1532, 19 Martii, loco Denton, praesentatus vero (solus in hoc genere) per Will. Knyght, Secreta∣rium Regis, vigore advocationis sive liberae dispositionis Canonicatus & Prebendae, quae proxime vacare contigerent in hac Regia Ca∣pella dicto Will. & aliis conjunctim & divisim per D. Regem Hen. 8. praeconcess. fuit Consi∣liarius Regius, Decanus Wellensis, Rector (vel Vicar) de Agmondesham in Bucks, & obiit in 1337. & Arch successit.

ROBERTUS ALDRICH, S. T. P. 7 Maii, 1534. installatus loco Sidnore, Coll. Regal. Cant.
Socius Etonensis Collegii Ludi-Magister, deinde Praepositus ibidem, Capellanus Regius, Ordinis Garterii Registrarius constitutus hoc Anno, consecratus Episcopus Carleolensis 1537.
SIMON SIMONDS, installatus 1535. 19 Aug. loco Welles, Coll. Regal. Cant. Socius, inde∣que Etonensis, Capellanus Regius, Vicarius de Bray.

SIMON HEYNES, S. T. P. installatus 1535. 24 Decemb. loco Sherton, Capellanus Regius, Decanus Exoniensis, Aedis Christi, Oxon Cano∣nicus, Commissionarius cum aliis pro visitati∣one hujus Liberae Capellae & Ecclesiarum Ca∣thedralium primo Edwardi sexti.
JACOBUS BLYTHE installatus 1536. 25 Aug. loco Plummer, Theol. Dr. Capellanus Regius, Vicarius de Wantage in Com. Berks, obiit & se∣pult. Windsorae 1546Vide pag. 143.
HENRICUS WILLIAMS, S. T. B installatus 1537. 26 Sept. loco Aldrich, in Ecclesia Colle∣giata de Southwell Canonicus, Rector Ecclesiae de West Ildesley. Deprivatus 1554.
RICHARDUS ARCH installatus 1537. 24 Jan. loco Wolman, Capellanus Regius.

JOHANNES LONDON, L. L. D. installatus 1540. 30 Sept. loco Lupton, Coll. Lyncolniensis, Oxon, Rector,Potius Novi Collegii Oxoniensis fuit Custos, de eo plura vide in Libro ab Hallo scripto, de Conjunctione familiarum bracensiu & Lancastrensium; edit. 1548. pag. 257. Capellanus Regius, ob. 1543.
OWENUS OGLETHORP installatus 1540. 14 Oct. loco Tate, postea Decanus vigesimus se∣cundus, 1553.
ANTONIUS BARKER, A. M. installatus 1541. 30 Nov. loco Clyfton, & Socius Coll. Etonensis.
ARTHUR COLE, A. M. installatus 1543. 18 Maii, loco Jacobi Mallet, fuit Socius Colle∣gii Etonensis.
JOHANNES ROBINS, S. T. B. installatus 1543. 22 Dec. loco Rawson, Coll. Omn. An. Socius electus 1520. insignis Mathematicus, ob. 1558. & sepultus WindsoraeVide page 167, 168..

FRANCISCUS MALETT, S. T. P. installatus 1543. 24 Dec. loco London, Capellanus Regius, Mariae Reginae Confessor, Linconicnsis Decanus, transtulit Erasmi Paraphrasin, in D. Johannem in Anglicanam Linguam. Obiit 1564Potius 1570..
HENRICUS AGLIONBY, S. T. P. installatus 1546. 12 Oct. loco Blythe, S. T. P. Capellanus Regius. Obiit 1552.

RICHARDUS COXE, S. T. P. installatus 1548. 16 Julii, loco Magnus, Coll. Regal. Cantab. So∣cius, Decanus Westmonast. ac Aedis Christi Oxon. Universitatis Oxon. Cancellarius; Eleemosyna∣rius Regius, Edw. 6. Cui etiam a Literarum institutione & a consiliis; exul regnante Maria, sub Elizabetha rediens ad Episcopatum Eliensem promotus.

OTWELL HOLINGSHEAD installatus 1549. loco Johannis Chambers, ab hoc Anno ad An∣num 1559. de serie & Annis in quibus installa∣ti sunt Canonici non satis constat. Numerus vero & nomina Canonicorum interim succe∣dentium sequuntur.
GULIELMUS TURNER, Decanus Wellensis, Edwardo sexto regnante.
NlCHOLAUS UDALL. GULIELMUS CHEDSEY, S. T. D. Archi-Diaconus Middlesexiae Maria regnante.
JOHANNES SOMER, S. T. B. ob. & sepultus est Windsorae, 1573.
THOMAS SLYTHURST, Coll. Sanctae Trinita∣tis, Oxon. per Thomam Pope Militem Fundato∣rem, Praeses primus constitutus.
—HOPWOOD.
—ESTE.
GULIELMUS SAXEY, obiit Windsorae repenti∣na morte correptus, & in claustro exteriori se∣pultus circa Annum 1574.
GULIELMUS DENYS, Praepos. Coll. Regin. Oxon.
WILL. DEVENISH. GULIELMUS ERMESTED. THOMAS RAWE, A. M. Vicarius de Wantage, obiit & sepultus Windsore, 1556.Vide Pag. 130..
JOHANNES BROWNE, S. T. B. Rector de Haseley, in Com. Oxon. Canonicatum resigna∣vit 1572. ubi sepultus est in Ecclesia de Hase∣ley.
JOHANNES BOWLE, S. T. B. Coll. Omn. Anim. Oxon. Socius, Prior nuper Monasterii de Mer∣ton in Surriâ, obiit 15 Aug. 1558. & sepultus suit Windsorae.

RICHARDUS BRUERNE, Aedis Christi Oxon. Canonicus, Etonensis Collegii (Ubi olim Socius
fuit) electus Praepositus circa Ann. 1563. Rec∣tor fuit etiam de Maple Durham in Com. Oxon. Obiit 1564Potius 1565, ut per Testam. patet..
—ISHAM.
SIMON ALEYN, Vicarius de Bray juxta Wind∣sore, installatus 1559. & obiit 1588.
HENRICUS RYLEY, S. T. B. installatus 1559. Rector de Stratford Sy in Com. Southampt. obiit 1586.
GEORGIUS MASON obiit 1563.

GEORGIUS WHITHORN, Minor Canonicus admissus 23 Hen. 8. installatus 1560. & ad Vi∣cariam de Rislip praesentatus 31 Hen. 8. Exul sub Maria, & sub Elizabetha rediens ad Canonica∣tum promotus est, obiit 1564.
EDWARDUS MORECROFTHic suit natu Lancastrensis, & liberalioribus artibus im∣utus in Collegio Aenea- Nasensi, Oxonii, in Anno 1552., installatus 1560.
Capellanus Regius, obiit 1580.
EDMUNDUS JOHNSONVide Stow's Survey of London, Edit. 1633. pag. 191., installatus 1560.

PAULUS FRENCH, S. T. B. installatus 1560. Coll. Omn. Anim. Socius, electus 1547. Eccle∣siae Cantuar. Praebendarius, Rector de Little Wit∣nam in Berks, obiit 1o Nov. & sepult. Windsorae 1600Vide pag. 144..

RICHARDUS REEVE, Coll. Omn. Anim. So∣cius, electus 1533. capellanus Regius Eccle∣siae Westmonast. Praebendarius, installatus 1561. Rector de Marsh Gibbon in Bucks, ob. 1594. Iste vir Ludi-magister fuit de Berchamstead in Com.
Hertf. sed tempestatibus Marianis agitatus, abin∣de cessit & latuit, donec sub Elizabetha sere∣nitas exoptata faeliciter suborta est.
GULIELMUS DAY, installatus 1564. loco Bruerne, postea Decanus vigesimus octavus 1572.
JOHANNES THOMSON, S. T. B. installatus 1564. Capellanus Regins. Obiit 1571.
EDMUNDUS FREAKE, T. D. installatus 1565. ad Episcopatum Roffensem promotus 1571. ad Norwicensem translatus 1575. indeque ad Vigorni∣ensem, 1584.
ANTONIUS RUSH, Th. Dr. installatus 1567. Decanus Cicestr. obitus & sepult. Windsorae 1577.
ROGERUS BROWNE, S. T. B. installatus 1571.
Coll. Regal. Cant. Socius, Rector de Farnham in Bucks, obiit & sepultus Windsorae 1601.
GULIELMUS WICKHAM. S. T. D. installatus 1571. Decan. Lincoln. ad Episcopatum ibid pro∣motus 1584. (ad Winton. demum translatus.

ROBERTUS JOHNSON, S. T. B. installatus 1572. 30 Julii loco Johannis Browne: Archi-Diaconus Leicestriae, Ecclesiae Roffensis bis Prae∣bendarius, & bis resignavit. Rector de Luffen∣ham in Com. Rutland. Obiit 1 Aug. 1625. Ca∣nonicatus sui 54.

Scholas duas Grammaticales publicas, & Hos∣pitalia duo pro pauperibus fundavit & doravit in dicto Com. Rutland. Et ex ejus beneficentiâ Concionatores apud Crucem Paulinam Londini, septimanatim percipiunt.
HUGO BLYTHE, S. T. B. Ludi-magister, Scholae Etonensis, installatus 1572. 28 Aug. loco Carew Decani: Archi-Diaconus Leicestrensis, obiit 610. Coll. Regal. Cantabrig. Socius suit.
GULIELMUS KING, S. T. B. installatus 1573. Coll. Regal. Cantab. Soc. Eccles. Cantuar. Prae∣bendarius, obiit 1590.
JOHANNES WOLWARD, 27 Feb. Marii 1573. installatus loco Somer, Etonensis Coll. olim Soc. Rector de Windlesham in Surrey, obiit 1598.

HERBERTUS WFSTPHALING, 30 Martii, 1577. installatus loco Rush, S. Th. Dr. Aedis Christi Oxon. Canonicus consecratus Episcopus Here∣ford. 1585. Terras & Tenementa ad valorem viginti librarum ad minus per Ann. Collegio Jesu in Oxon. donavit.
JOHANNES KING, A. M. installatus 1580. 26 Maii, loco Morecroft, Coll. S. Petri Cantab. Socius, Rector Ecclesiarum de Taplow in Bucks, & de Stourton in Wilts, obiit & sepultus est Windsorae, 1607.

GULIELMUS WILSON, S. T. P. installatus 1584. 10 Dec. loco Wickham, Coll. Mert. Oxon. Socius, Praebendarius Roffen. & Rector de Cliff, prope Roff. obiit 15 Maii, 1615Vide pag. 157.. Aet. 73. & sepultus est in Ecclesia St. Georgii Windsorae: Uxoratus.
ALEXANDER SOUTHAKE, A. M. installatus 1585. 10 Jan. loco Westphaling, obiit 1606.
GULIELMUS HARRISON, S. T. B. installatus 1586. 24 Apr. loco Ryley, obiit & sepult. Wind∣sorae, 1593. Rector fuit de Radwinter.

ROBERTUS CHALONER, S. T. P. installatus 1589. loco Harwood, Aedis Christi, Oxon. a∣lumnus, Rector de Agmondesham in Buks. Ubi obiit & sepultus est, 1° Maii, 1621. Ex terris
& tenementis suis non ita pridem perquisitis per testamentum suum donavit 40 l. Ann. pro sti∣pendiis Ludi-Magistrorum de Knaresborow in Com. Ebor. & de Agmondesham praedict. necnon 10 l. 10 Sol. per Annum pauperibus ibid. & 4 l. per Ann. pauperibus de Okingham in Berks, & de Goldesborow in Com. Ebor. a tempore mortis suae percipiend. & in pecuniis numeratis 50 l. in∣ter alios pauperes distribuend. Praeter 2 l. pet Ann. pro stipendio Praelectoris in Theologia aut pro exhibitione 3 pauperum Scholarium (ad Electionem Abeli Rolle haeredis sui) in Aede Christi, Oxon. & 6 l. per Ann. pauperibus de Nova Windsore, & 40 Sol. pauperibus de East Oakley, & 40 Sol. concionatori apud Bray post decessum Christianae Ukoris suae. In toto 84 l. 10 s. per Ann. in pios usus in perpetuum.

ERASMUS WB, S. T. B. installatus 1590. 30 Sept. loco W. King, Coll. Omn. Anim. Oxon. Socius, electus 1567. Archi-Diaconus Bucks. Rector de West Ildeslye, & de Ham in Dioc. Sarum. Obiit 24 Mar. 1613.Vide pag. 144. Aet. 63. & sepultus est Windsorae.
Decem Acras terrae boscalis successoribus suis in Rectoria de West Ildesley, & decem carucatas ligni socalis quinque pauperibus ibid. Annuatim in perpetuum percipiend. per Testamentum suum legavit.

THOMAS WHIYF, S. T. P. installatus, 1593. loco Harrison, Aulae Magd. Oxon. Alumnus, Ca∣nonicus Ecclesiarum S. Pauli, Lond. ac Aedis Christi, Oxon. Thesaurarius Ecclesiae Sarum, Rec∣tor
S. Dunstani, Lond. ubi & sepultus est. obiit 2 Mart. 1623. Hospitale pro decem pauperi∣bus in Civitate Bristoll. unde ortum suum duxit cum dotatione satis ampla fundavit, & 32 l. per Ann. inter tres Vicarias trium Ecclesiarum Pa∣rochialium ibid, in eorum relevamen (quorum redditus antea admodum exiles erant) in per∣petuum distribuend. assignavit. Terras quoque & tenementa ad valorem fere 200 l. per Ann. pro publici Professoris in Morali Philosophia sti∣pendio, & pro exhibitionibus quinque Schola∣rium in Aula Magd. & in alios hujusmodi pios usus erogand. semetipso adhuc in vivis existente Universitati Oxon. donavit. Totam demum substantiam suam (paucis quibusdam legatis ex∣ceptis) hoc est, Manerium de Bradwell in Essex, cum aliis terris & tenementis ad valorem sexcen∣tarum librarum per Ann. praeter satis amplam pecuniarum summam ad novam Ministrorum in Civitate Lond. Incorporationem cum Hospitali annexo instituendam fovendamque per Testa∣mentum suum moriens legavit.

ALEXANDER NOWELL, S. T. P. installatus 1594. 28 Apr. loco Reve, Coll. Aenei-Nasi Oxon. Socius, postea Principalis ibid. & Benefactor praecipuus, Decanus de Pauli, Lond. ubi obitus & sepultus est, Anno 1601. & Nuthall successit.

CAROLUS SUNNYBANK, installatus 1598. 28 Apr. loco Wolward, S. T. D. Aedis Christi, Oxon. Alumnus, Rector de Haseley in Com. Oxon. Donativae de Wrotham in Com. Cant. Possessor. ob. 12. Oct. 1638. & sepultus est in choro Ec∣clesiae de Haseley, 14 ejusdem Mensis: Ubi humi prostratus lapis sepulcralis hac Inscrip∣tione est insignitus.
Carolus Sunnibank, S. T. D. hujus Ecclesiae Rector, & Windsoriensis Canonicus, quod mortale habuit, hic deposuit 14 Octob. 1638. Veni cito Domine Jesu.
HENRICUS BEAUMONT, S. T. P. 6 Nov. loco French, 1600. postea Decanus trigesimus tertius.

JOHANNES CHAMBER, A. M. installatus. 1601. 17 Junii, loco Browne, A. M. Coll. Mert. Oxon. Socius, cui moriens mille libras le∣gavit. Collegii etiam Etonensis Socius, Medico-Theologus, ob. Mense Jul. 1604. & sepultus Windsorae.Vide pag. 145..

RICHARDUS FIELD, installatus 1604.Vita viri hujus clarissimi a Filio suo compilata, & Anno 1716. in 8vo. a Johanne Le Neve suit in lucem edita. 3 Aug. loco Chamber, Aulae Magd. Oxon, Alumnus, ubi statim post susceptum in Artibus Magisterii Gradum per 7 Annos, vel circiter (sciens pru∣densque cum egometipse oculatus & acritus testis interfui) nedum Logicis solum & Philo∣sophicis praelectionibus & disputationibus quoti∣dianis praefuit, sed simul etiam Theologicas in∣stitutiones primo, deinde vero controversias ad∣versus Bellarminum, & alios Pontificios publice & summo cum applausu, magnoque Auditorum concursu quovis Die Dominico tractavit. Postea (Theol. Bacc.) in Ecclesia Cathedrali Winton. indeque Lincolniensi Legum Municipaliom Hos∣pitio Theologiae Praelector. Tandem vero (Th.
Dr.) Reginae Elizabethae, necnon Jacobo Regi a Sacris, Decanus de Gloucestr. & Rector de Bur∣cleer in Com. Southampton. Libros 5 de Eccle∣sia eruditissime scripsit, in quibus summum & primarium illud Romanensium propugnaculum, seu potius fastuosa & fucata Ecclesiae suae ven∣ditatio discutitur, Larvaque illa ad territandum meticulosos, & ad alliciendum incautos super∣inducta diripitur. Duos libros dum recensere, & a venenatis profugorum quorundam moribus vindicare satagit, immaturâ morte paereptus (Aetatis suae 57) pie in domino obdormivit 21 Nov. 1616. & sepultus Windsorae, cui successit Willson.

JOHANNES BUCKERIDGE, installatus 1606. 15 Apr. loco Southake, S. T. P. Collegii S. Johan. Oxon. Socius, deinde Praeses ibidem, Rector Ecclesiae S. Aegidii extra Cripplegate, London, consecratus Episcopus Roffensis 1611. Canoni∣catum hunc & Ecclesiam praedictam per Com∣mendam retinens cum Episcopatu. Authorita∣tem Regiam divinitùs institutam adversus Papa∣lem humanitùs introductam, in rebus temporali∣bus duobus libris, 1614. editis, solide & plenis∣sime propugnavit.

MRRDOCHAEUS ALDEM, A. M. installatus 1607. 14 Maii, loco Johan. King, A. M. Me∣dico-Theologus, Aedis Christi Oxon. Alumnus, dein Etonensis Collegii Socius, obiit 1615. & se∣pultus in Ecclesia Parochiali de Nova Windsore, cui successit Joh. King, Praedecessoris sui fratri∣nus.

THOMAS FRITH. Author Operis istius, natus in Agro Cantiano, electus ab Aulâ Beatae Mariae Magdalenae Oxoniensis, in Societatem Collegii Om∣nium
Animarum 1592. Postea in Uxorem duxit Elizabeth à Wood, 29 Jan. 1605. & 12 Nov. in eodem Anno admissus ad gradum S. T. B. in∣stallatus 7 Aug. 1610. loco Blythe, per pro∣curatorem, & in propria persona successit 1 Sept. S. T. B. Rector Capellae de Elmley in Com. Cantii.
THOMAS SHEAFE, installatus 1614. 29 Mar. loco Webb, S. T. Dr. Coll. Regal. Cantab. Soci∣us, Rector de Welford in Berks.

RICHARDUS LANGLEY installatus 1615. 19 Maii, loco Wilson, per Procuratorem, dum ipse valetudinarius seu potius semimortuus 4 vel 5 Die sequente, obiit & sepult. Windsorae, S. T. D. Coll. Regal. Cantabr. Socius, deinde Etonensis Ludi-Magister, Rector de Packlesham, & de Lachindon Lollyngs in Essex, obiit apud Windsore, 1615.
OLIVERUS LLOYD, L. L. D. installatus 1615. Maii 26. Coll. Omn. Anim. Oxon. Socius, electus 1592. cui per viam permutationis suc∣cessit Montague, 1617.
JOHANNES KYNG, S. T. P. installatus 1615. 23 Nov. loco Aldem, Coll. Mert. Oxon. Socius, Praebendarius Westmonast. & Rector de Stourton in Wilts.
THOMAS HORNE, S. T. P. installatus 1616. 19 Octob. loco Nttall, Merton. Oxon. Socius, & Vicarius de Isleworth in Middlesexia.

EDMUNDUS WILSON, M. D. installatus 1616. 18 Decemb. loco Field, in Collegium Medico∣rum Lond. ante Installationem admissus, Coll. Regal. Contab. Socius, eo quod insra annum post installationem non fuit in Presbyterum ordina∣tus, Canonicatu privatus est.

RICHARDUS MOUNTAGUE, Coll. Regal. Cant. Socius, deinde in hac Capella Regia per octo Annos Theol. praelector. Postea Etonensis Col∣legii Socius, & Decanus Hereford, per viam tandem permutationis cum Olivere Lloyd, cessit Decanatu praedicto, & factus est Archi-Diaco∣nus Heref. atque etiam installatus hic Canoni∣cus 6 Sept. 1617. Theol. Bacc. Capellanus Regius, Rector Ecclesiarum de Stamford Rivers in Essex, & de Petworth in Sussex. Historiam Ecclesiasticam a Pontificiis, praecipue a Baro∣ni, variis figmentis & imposturis suis corrup∣tam & depravatam, ex candidiss. Regis Jacobi mandato, purgare, & ad veracem Antiquitatis normam reformare aggreditur, exercitatini∣bus quibusdam praeludii Anno 1622. editis, dumque ad opus ipsum se accingit, ex hac pa∣laestra, ad alia ejusdem fere fannae Zizani ex Agro Domini extirpanda, portionemque Dei a manu Sacrilega [The History of Tythes] nec non Doctrinam Evangelicam è lingua maledicam [The Gag] vindicandam avocatus est.

GALFRIDUS GOODMAN, S. T. P. installatus 1617. 20 Dee. loco Wilson, Coll. S. Trinitatis, Cantab. Alumnus, ex Decano Roffensi consecra∣tus est Episcopus Glouc. 1624. Canonicatum hunc una cum Rectoria de West Ildesley in Berk. per Commendam retinens.

THOMAS OTES, S. T. P. installatus 1621. 4 Maii, loco Chaloner, S. T. Dr. Coll. Magd. Oxon. Socius, Capellanus Regius, Ecclesiae S. Pauli, Lond. Praebendarius, Rector de Stoke Hammond in Bucks. Obiit & sepultus Windsorae, 1623.

THOMAS SOME, S. T. P. installatus 1522. 14 Apr. loco Spalatensis nuper Decani, Coll. S. Petri Cantabr. Socius, Th. Dr. Ecclesiae S. Pauli, Lond. Praebendarius, Vicarius de Stanes in Comitatu Middlesexiensi.

JOHANNES ELLY, installatus 1623. 22 Nov. loco Otes, Th.... Coll. Mert. Oxon. Socius, Rector Ecclesiae deNon occurrit hic Vir inter nomina Rectorum Ecclesiae hu∣jusce, nec inter Canonicos Ecclesiae Cathedralis Vigorniensis. Newton Longaville in Bucks, & Ecclesiae Cathedralis Wigorniensis Praebendarius.

JOHANNES KYNG, S. T. P. installatus 1625. 6 Aug. loco Johnson, Aedis Christ Oxon. Alum∣nus, & deinde Canonicus ibidem. Postquam Orator Academiae Oxon. publicus fuisset, Domini Johannis Kyng, nuper Episcopi Lond. digniss. fi∣lus 2us. Ecclesiae D. Pauli, Lond. Praebendarius, Rector Ecclesiae de Remenham in Berks.

DAVID STOKES, A. M. installatus 1628. 2 Julii, loco Mountague, Socius Coll. vel Dom. S. Petri Cantab. indeque Etonensis, Rector Ecclesiae de Binfield in Com. Berks. Obiit 10 Maii, 1669. & sepultus est in hacVide pag. 175. Capella.
GILBERTUS PRIMEROSIUS, S. T. P. installatus 1628. 21 Jul. loco D. Buckeridge, natione Sco∣tus, S. Th. Dr. Capellanus Domini Regis, Ec∣clesiae Gallicanae Lond. Minister, & obiit ad cal∣cem anni, 1642.

DIV1.HEAD: Hactenus Tho. Fryth, istius Catalogi Author; sequitur Continuatio per D. Geo. Evans, & alios.
DIV1.P: DANIEL COLLINS, S. T. P. installa∣tus 1631. 11 Martii (loco Frith) olim Socius Coll. Regal. Cant. Ca∣roli 1. a Sacris, in hac Capella prae∣lector in Theol. per 31 Annos, Soci∣us Coll. Eton. Vicarius de Ruislip, & Rector de Cowley, in Middlesex.
In Catalogo Sociorum Coll. Regal. Cantab. haec leguntur de Dan. Collins.

Anno 1594. Daniel Collins (electus Scholaris) Son of Baldwin Collins, sometimes Fellow of King's Coll. afterwards Fellow and Vice Provost of Eton, was B. D. Lecturer at Tryng in Bucks, Parson of Pulham, Lecturer of Windsore, Vicar of Ruislip; Fellow of Eton after the Death of his Father Baldwin, 1616. an excellent Preacher, D. D. Chaplain to King Charles the Ist. Prebend of Windsor, Parson of Cowley, Vice-Provost of Eton many Years together: He dyed at Cowley, 29 Decemb. 1648.

THOMAS HOWELL, S. T. P. Coll. Jesu Oxon. installatus 1636. 26 Novemb. loco Horne (qui mortalitatem exuit 4 Nov. sub Hora sext. pro∣merid.) D. in Theol. Capellanus Regius Caroli,
Rector Ecclesiae de West Horsley in Surria, & Walbroke Lond. tandem Episcopus Bristol.

SAMUEL BAKER, loco King, sen. installatus 1638. 20 Sept. Episcopus Lond. summi Angliae Thesaurarii Capellanus Domesticus, S. T. B. Coll. Christi Cant. Rector Ecclesiarum S. Mariae in monte, & S. Christopheri Lond. Ecclesiae D. Pauli Lond. Praebendarius, 17 Maii seq. resig∣avit hunc Canonicatum, & in Ecclesiam Can∣tuariensem translatus est.

JACOBUS ROWLANDSON, S. T. P. installa∣tus 1638. 6 Novemb. loco Sunnibanke. Coll. Re∣ginae Oxon. Caroli 1. a Sacris, Rector Ecclesiae de Tysted in Com. Southampt. & Magister Hos∣pitalis S. Mar. Magd. prope Winton, ob. 9. seq. Maii, & sepultus est Windsorae.

GULIELMUS BROUGH, S T. P. installatus 1638. 1° Febr. loco King, jun. Coll. Christi Cant. Carolo I°. a Sacris, Rector Ecclesiae S. Mich. Cornhill, Lond. postea Decanus Glouc. Obiit WindsoraeVide pag. 175., 5 Julii, 1671.

THOMAS BROWNE, S. T. P. per cessionem Sam. Baker, installatus 1639. 28 Maii, Alum∣nus Aedis Christi Oxon. Academiae Procurator senior 1636. Archi-Episc. Cant. Capellanus Domesticus, Rector Ecclesiae S. Mariae Majoris, sive Aldermary Lond. dein Rector de Odding∣ton, in Com. Oxon. obiit WindsoraeVide pag. 199., 6 Decemb. 1673.

GEORGIUS GILLINGHAM, S. T. P. loco Elly, installatus 2o Nov. 1639. Aulae Latepor∣tensis
(Coll. Pemb.) Oxon. Regi a Sacris, & Rector Ecclesiae de Chalton in Com. Southampt. ob. 16 Decemb. 1668.

JOHANNES HALES, A. M. installatus 1639 27 Junii, loco Rowlandson, C. C. C. Oxon. Socius Coll. Mert. Linguae Graecae in Acad. Professor Regius, Socius Coll. Eton. obiit 19 Maii, 1656. & sepultus est in Coemiterio Australi Coll. EtonVide inter Monumenta Anglicana a Le Neve edita sub Anno 1656..

JOHANNES POCKLINGTON, S. T. P. loco Sheafe, installatus 1639. 5 Jan. Aul. Pembroc. Cantab. Socius, Regis Capellanus, Rector Ec∣clesiae de Yelden in Com. Bedford, Vicarius Ec∣clesiae de Waresley in Com. Huntingdon, Praeben∣darius Ecclesiae de Peterborough, post unum an∣num omnibus dignitatibus & promotionibus ex∣utus per Parliamentum.

HERBERT CROFT, S. T. P. Herberti Croft, de Com. Heref. Eq. Aur. filius, ex Aede Christi Oxon. Regi a Sacris, Eccles. Cathed. Wigorn. Praebendarius & Rector de Hardyng prope Hen∣ley, in Canonicatum Doctoris Pocklington, in∣stallatus est 1° Jul. 1641. postea Decanus He∣ref. & tandem Episcopus, ubi obiit &Vide Eccles. Herefordens. antiq. pag. 98. sepultus est prope Altare.

HUGO CRESSEY, S. T. P. ad finem Anni 1642. in Canonicatum Primerosii vacuum, e∣lectus, nunquam vero admissus. Paulo post Romanam amplexus est fidem & per varias Eu∣ropae partes migravit, postquam in Angliam re∣versus, plures edidit libros, praesertim Rati∣ones, cur Romae Ecclesiam Anglicanae praetulit,
(inter quas asserit, se plurimum instigari a Fa∣naticâ ea impietate & bello isto exitiali a Reformatis incaepto & peracto) & Historiam Ecclesiae Anglicanae primaevae. Demum ad vo∣luptates vitae rusticae secessit, & moriens Aug. 10. 1674. sepultus est in Ecclesiâ Orientalis Grin∣stead in Comitatu Sussexiensi.
Ab hac Aerâ 1642. nulto Canonicorum ad∣missiones occurrunt, dum ad annum felicissi∣mum 1660. Accedimus.

EDWARDUS FULHAM, S. T. P. ex Aede Christi Oxon. Acad. Procur. 1639. Episcopi Oxon. Sacellanus, Rector de Hampton Poyle in Com. Oxon. Praebendarius Cicestrensis, Vicarius de Bray in Com. Berks, Rector de West Ildelley in eodem Com. installatus est in Canonicatum Doctoris Some, 12o Julii, 1660.

ANTONIUS HAWLES, S. T. P. Coll. Reginae Oxon. Praebendarius & Archi-Diaconus. Sarum, Rector de Knoyle, & postea de Bishopston in Com. Wilts, installatus est in Canonicatum Magistri Hales, 1660. 18 Jul. Regi exulanti a sacris fuit, ob. 16 Januar. 1663. & sepultus est in hac Ca∣pellaVide pag. 145..

JOHANNES LLOYD, S. T. P. Coll. Omn. Anim. Oxon. Socius, a Sacris Regi exulanti, Jul. 18. 1660. installatus est in Canonicatum Hugonis Paulini de Cressey, (in quem quo minus ipse installaretur res Anglicae turbatae in primis impediere, & tandem defectio propria ab Ecclesiâ Anglicanà) obiit Dr. Lloyd, 9 Apr. 1671.

RADULPHUS BRIDEOAKE, S. T. P. è Coll. Nov. Oxon. Caroli 2. Capellanus, Ecclesiae S. Bartholom. juxta Escambium Regale, Lond. ut & Ecclesiae de Witney in Com. Oxon. Rector, 18 Julii, 1660. installatus est in Canonicatum Doctoris Howell Episcopi Bristol, postea Rector Ecclesiae de Standish in Com. Lancast. Decanus Sarisburiensis, & tandem Episcopus Cicestrensis, obiitVide pag. 158. 5 Octob. 1678. & sepultus est in hac Capella.

GEORGIUS HALL, S. T. P. Coll. Exon. Oxon. Caroli 2. Capellanus, Archi-Diaconus Cantuar. Vicarius S. Botolphi prope Aldersgate Lond. in∣stallatus est Julii 18. 1660. in Canonicatum Doctoris Goodman, Episc. Glouc. & ipse post bien∣nium consecratus est Episcopus Cestrensis 11°. Maii, 1662.

GULIELMUS CHAMBERLAYNE, S. T. P. Coll. Trin. Cant. Socius, Ducis Ormondiae Capel∣lanus Domesticus, installatus est in Canonica∣tum Doctoris Collins, 2° Aug. 1660. & obiitVide pag. 168.. 18 Maii 1666. & sepultus in hac Capella.

GEORGIUS EVANS, A. M. Coll. Jesu Can∣tab. Socius, Vicarius de Nova Windsore, instal∣latus est in Canonicatum Doctoris Giles, 30 Jul. 1660. postea Rector Ecclesiae S. Benedicti Lond. per indenturam a Coll. praesentatus [Im∣propriatio est & tenet eam per Indent. è Coll. Windsore] dein Rector de HitchamVide inter Monumenta Anglicana a Le Neve edita sub Anno 1701. licet in Coemiterio (ubi inbumatur corpus) non Ecclesia extat Monumentum. in Agro Bucks, ubi obiit 20 die Martii, 1701.

JOHANNES HEAVER, S. T. P. Aulae Clarensis Cantab. Socius, installatus est 1661. 12 Martii, loco Croft, Soc. Coll. Eton, & Vicarius de Nova Windsore, ob. 23 Junii, 1670. & in hac Capella sepultusVide page 107, & 176..
HENRICUS CARPENTER, S. T. P. Coll. Exon. in Acad. Oxon. loco Hall, Maii 20. 1662. Praebendarius de Sarum, Rector Ecclesiae S. Dio∣nysiii Back-Church, Lond. obiit Oct. 14. Anno 1662.

PETRUS MEWS, L. L. D. loco Carpenter, 1662. Octob. 30. Socius, postea Praeses Collegii Div. Johannis Bapt. Oxon. Archi-Diaconus Berks, Regis Capellanus, Rector Ecclesiae S. Mariae in Reading, Decanus Roffensis, & tandem (Feb. 9. 1672.) Episcopus Bathon. & Wellensis, & demum Wintniensis, ubi obiit 9 Novembris, 1706.

JOHANNES DURELL, A. M. loco Hawles, Feb. 11°.. 1663. Coll. Mert. Oxon. Alumnus. Ecclesiae Gallicanae apud Hospitium de le Savoy Minister, (1682.) Decanus Windsore, & Praebendarius Dunelmensis, obiit 6 Jun. 1683. & in hac Ca∣pella sepultusVide page 176, 242..
RICHARDUS MILWARD, loco Chamberlayne, Jun. 3. 1666. S. T. P. Coll. S. Trin. Cantab. Rector de Braxted in Com. Essex, Vicarius de Isleworth. Obiit 20 Decemb. 1680.

JOHANNES BUTLER, S. T. P. loco Gillingham, 1686. Jan. 26. Dubliniae in Hibernia educatus, Principi Ruperto ut & Regi a Sacris, Rector de
Hartley Wespall in Com. Hanton. Obiit 12 Aug. 1682. & in hac Capella sepultusVide page 177..
HENRICUS WOTTON, A. M. 1669. installa∣tus 28 Maii, loco Stokes, Coll. Mert. Oxon. Rec∣tor de Parendon in Essex, resignavit Canonicatum 1 Maii, 1671.

THOMAS VYNER, 29 Jul. S. T. P. in 1670. installatus, loco Heaver, Aulae Catherinae Cantab. Alumnus, Rector de Bradwell in Essex, Praeben∣darius Gloucestrensis, postea Decanus ibid. obiit 11 Apr. 1673. & sepultus est in Capella Beatae Mariae Virginis pone Altare Ecclesiae Cathedralis Claudiocestriensis, ubi corpus tegitur lapide nigro sepulchrali hoc Epitaphio insignito.

Q.P: H. S. E. Venerabilis Vir Thomas Vyner, S. T. P. Hujus Ecclesiae Decanus, & Windsorianae Praebendarius, Illustris genere, Pietate in Deum, Venustate Ingenii, Comitate Morum, Integritate Vitae illibatae longe illustrior.
Qui summo Amicorum luctu & maerore decessit, April. 11.

Anno
Dom. 1673.
Aetatis 44.

JOHANNES SAUMARES, A. M. loco Lloyd, Apr. 19. 1671. Installatus, Coll. Pembroc. Oxon.
Decanus de Guernsey, Rector Ecclesiae de Hartley Wespall in Com. Hanton. Obiit September 1. 1697. & in hac Capella sepultusVide page 178.

GREGORIUS HASCARD, loco Wotton, Maii 9. 1671. installatus, A. M. Coll. Emanuel. Cantab. Rector de Bishops-Stoke, Ecclesiarum vulgo nun∣cupat Trinity & Queenhit he Lond. postea S. T. P. & Rector Ecclesiae St. Clementis Danorum Lond. Praebendarins de Sarum. Obiit 15 Novqmbris, 1708.
PETRUS SCOTT, L. L. D. loco Brough, Julii 13. 1671. Coll. Oriell Oxon. & Aulae Catherinae Cantab. Alumnus, & obiit 26 Decembris, 1689.

THOMAS DUGHTY, S. T. P. loco Mews, Feb. 14. 1672. Coll. Magd. Cantab. Rector de Bishops-Stoke in Com. Hanton. Duci Eborac. a Sacris, Rector de Clewer, prope Windsore, Com. Berks. Obiit & sepultus est in hac CapellaVide page 178.
ISAACUS VOSSIUS, L. L. D. Gerardi Filius, Belga, loco Viner, Maii 12. 1673. & obiit 11 Februarii, 1688.
ROBERTUS YOUNG, A. M. loco Browne, Decemb. 19. 1673. Coll. Regal. Cantab. Socius, Ruperto Principi 2 Sacris, & Etonensis Collegii Socius. Obiit mense Auguste 1716.

RICHARDUS MEGGOTT, S. T. P. loco Ryves, 2 Aug. 1677. Coll. Reginae Cantab. Rector S. Olavi in Burgo de Southwarke, Vicarius de Twic∣kenham, in Com. Middlesex, postea Decanus Wintoniensis, obiit Decembris 7. 1692.

JOHANNES ROSEWELL, loco Brideoak, 1678. Octob. 26. S. T. B. Coll. C. C. Oxon. Socius,
Scholae Etonensts Informator. Socius Coll. Eton. loco Ingelo in Aug. vel Sept. 1683. & obiit Etonae 30 Octob. 1684Quaeras alibi Epitaphium inter Monumenta Anglicana ae Le Neve edita sub Anno 1684.
THOMAS SPRATT, S. T. P. loco Millward, 14 Jan. 1680. Coll. Wadham Soc. Praebenda∣rius Westmonast. Regi a Sacris, Decanus West mo∣nasteriensis, & Episcopus Roffensis, obiit 20 Maii, 1713.

JOHANNES BARROW, A. M. loco Buttler▪ Aug. 26. 1682. Aulae S. Edmundi Oxon, D. Gu∣lielmo Temple Baronetto, ad Batavos Legato a Sacris, Vicarius de Nova Windsore. Obiit 19 Martii, 1684. & in hac Capella sepultusVide pag. 172.
I. EDWARDUS JONES, A. M. installatus 29 Septembris, 1684.
II. JOHANNES WICKART, A. M. loco Sptat, Episcopi Roffensis, Nov. 7. 1684.

GULIHLMUS CAVE, S. T. P. loco Rosewell, 21 Novembris, 1684. obiit 4 Aug. 1713. & se∣pultus in Ecclesia Beatae Mariae apud Islington in Comitatu Middlesexiae, ubi subsequens legitur Inscriptio (Monumento Boreali istius Ecclesiae parieti affixo his verbis.
DIV1.Q:
Juxta heic (ad imum Pulpiti gradum) Conditur quod claudi potuit GULIELMI CAVE, S. TH. PR. Canonici WINDESORIENSIS, CAROLO II. a Sacris Domesticis, Hujus Ecclesiae per XXVIII. Annos Vicarii.
Natus est Decemb. XXX. An. MDCXXXVII. Obiit Aug. IV. Ann. MDCC XIII. IV. Filiis & II. Filiabus eodem circiter loco ex australi Latere conditis, accessit tandem ANNA (GUALT. STONEHOUSE, S. T. B. filia unica) Mater Pientissima, Conjux charissima, quae quidem obiit Jan. X. MDCXCI. Quisquis es Viator, homo cum sis Ossa nostra ne violes, depositi cineres quiescant in Pace, Abi mortalitatis memor, nec te incautemSic. Orig. rapiat suprema dies.

DIV1.HEAD: UPTON, in Morton Hundred, Berkshire.
DIV1.P: THIS was antiently the Seat and Inheritance of a Branch of the Family of Latton, of Latton, in North Wiltshire, who derive them∣selves from the House of Estoteville, or Stutville, a noble Race, so call'd, from a Borough of that Denomination in Upper Nor∣mandy, and they were formerly under that Name.
Of this House was William de Stutville, made Cardinal by Eugenius the 4th, in the Year of our Lord God 1439. He dy'd in the Year 1482.

These Stutvilles, after the Conquest, were Barons of Lydesdale Castle in Cmberland, crea∣ted Earls of Yorkshire, (says Mr. Cambden) and much sam'd in the Barons Wars for their Prowess, and large Possessions in the Counties also of Rutland, Lincoln, and Warwick, where they were planted at Monks-Kirby, afterwards given by John de Stutville to the Monks of Pipwell in Northamptonshire, for the Health of the Souls of his Father, Mother, Brothers and Sisters, his own, and those of Hen. the 2d. and his Queen.

The same Author, in his Remains, suffici∣ently shews, That Sirnames were first given
for Distinction of Families, which afterwards descended to the eldest Son only, the rest ta∣king their Names from the Lands or Possssi∣ons allotted for their Portions; and, tis, at least, probable, that Walter de Latton (who ap∣pears. fromrm unquestionable Records, to have been many Ages since Planted in that Place with plentiful Fortune) tho' he changed his Name on his removal, yet forgot not to take the Paternal Coat along with him, which has since continu'd in the Family thro▪ many Ge∣nerations, and is still the Bearing of John Latton, Es{que} of Eshur-Place in the County of Surrey; as it also is of the Stutvilles of Brinkley in Cambridgeshire, viz. Party per Pale, A. and S. a Saltier ingrailed Ermins, and Ermin coun∣terchanged.
Amongst the small Remains of the Family Writings, there is still to be seen a Corrody of 414 Years old; a true Copy of which take as follows.

OMnibus Christi fidelibus praesens scriptum vi∣suris vel audituris, Henricus Permissione Di∣vinâ Abbas Cirencestrensis, & ejusdem loci Con∣ventus, salutem in Domino, Noverit Universitas vestra nos concessisse. Johan. de Latton, & Isa∣belle Uxori, ejusdem sub forma & conditione que sequitur subscripta, viz. Quelibet hebdomada, qucmdi vixerint simul, quatuor decem albos coro∣nerios & novem Gallonas cerevisie, scil. quinque Gal∣lonas cerevisie Conventnalis, & quatuor de cerevisiâ Capellanorum & annum ferculum qualibet die de Coquina nostra, sicut libere servienes in die recipi∣unt de domo nostra, percipiend. itaque si dict. Isa∣bella diutius supervixerit, statim post mortem dict. Joh. medietas omnium superius concessorum totaliter cessabit. Et pro dicta concessione predict. Joh. nobis & Ecclesie nostre totaliter remisit & de se & here∣dibus suis in perpetuam quietem, clamavit totum jus & elamium quod habuit vel aliquo modo habere po∣tuit, cum reversione quocunque in terris & tene∣menis cum omnibus pertinentiis suis quas Gualte∣rus, Pater predict. Johan. de nobis assignatas tenuit in Latton, & dictus John. & heredes sui dicts terras & tenementa nobis & Ecclesie nostre fine de∣minutione quacque ple & integrè warrantiza∣bunt. Et si continget (quod absit) predictos Johan∣nem & Isabellam a predict. Warrantia quoquo mo∣do deficere, vel in dict. tenementis aliquod juris vel elamii clamae seu vindicate, ex tnc, dicti Abbas & Conventus a Preatione omni premissarum absque
calumpnia cujuslibet omnino cessabunt in perpetuum. In cujus rei Testimonium partes predict. huic script. indentato sigilla sua alternatim apposuerunt. Dat Cirencestrie in Fest. Purific. Beat. Marie, An. Regn. Regis Edw. Fil. Henr. tricessim. tertio.
Corrodii ver. Cop. Dat. 33 E. 1. An. 1305. Abbat. Hen. Hamptonel.

This Indenture, in Consideration of all its Particularities, is (according to Sir Henry St. Geroge, Garter, King at Arms) very rarely to be produced by any Family; and from the Date hereof, this John and Isabel retir'd from the World in their old Age, ending their Days in Religion.
In the College of Arms, London, is the fol∣lowing Record.
Milo de Morton, dedit omnes terras & tenemen∣ta in Chilton, Ricardo fili. Barth. de Hackburn. & Johan. Fil. Wilhelm. de Latton, 18 E. 2.

In the same Reign, in the Year of our Lord God, 1325. Wilhelmus de Latton settl'd himself at Upton beforemention'd, as appears by the Records in the Herald's Office, where they continu'd for the space of seven Generations.

He marry'd Joan, Daughter and sole Heir of Walter, Son and Heir of Walter, Son and Heir of William de Percy, from a younger Branch of the House of Northumberland, who (says Mr. Cambden) derive themselves in a direct Line, from the Emperor Charles the Great, in the Year of Christ 802.
She liv'd in the 14th Year of Edw. the Third,

The paternal Coat of this Walte was A: Fusils in Fess S. taken from the Fusils former∣ly born by the Percy's before they were Earls of Northumberland, and this Coat was afterwards the Bearing of Latton for some Time, in Com∣pliment to that Heiress, as appears by the Office of Arms, but they soon resum'd their former Coat of Stu vilie.
Amongst the Writings of the Family are also still to be discover'd the following Manors, Lands and Tenement which they were former∣ly Possessors of in this County only.

LIST.ITEM: Drayot Park, held from St. John's Coll▪ in Oxford for many Years in the Fami∣ly.

DIV1.P: How many of these were Manors is not easi∣ly discovered at this distance of Time; the most of 'em seem to have been so.
John Latton, of Chilten, Berks, Es{que} was High Sheriff of this County the 32d of the Queen.

The last Residence of this Family in Berkshire was at Kingston Bakepuze, in the Hundred of Oke, which Seat and Manors were purchas'd
by John Latton, of Chilton, Es{que} in the 33d of Hen. 8. in the Year of our Lord God 1542. and descended to William Latton his Son and Heir, in the 38th of the Queen, as by the following Inquisuion.

Valor sive extentus An. val, Maneriorum ter. & tenementorum & ceter. quorumcunque in Comit. Berks, qua nup. fuere Johannis Latton, Armig. defunct▪ & que per fin. post mort. ejusd. Johannis cuidam Guiel. Latton, fil. & herd. suo descendunt & descendere deeant in usu Possessione & reversione. Qui quide Joh. Latton, Armig. ob. Octob. 16. An. Regni Domine Regin. 38 Wilhelm. Latton, ad tunc, plen. etat. viz. 22 An. Temp mort. dicti Joh. Patris sui prout▪ per inquisit. inde capt. apud Maidenhead, Com. Berks, 19 Maii, An▪ Reg. 13o. plen. poterit apparere, &c.

Manerium de Kingston Ferrars, & Chartley, ac ter. & tenementa aup. Domini. Ferrars & Chartley, in Kingston, predict. tent. de Domina Regin. in capit. viz. per centassim. partem-Faodi milis. & val. per An. 6▪ 1.
Manerium de Kingston Longville tent. de D∣mina Regin. in capit. per servit. quarte parties uniue feod. milit. val. par An. 100.

Manerium de Kingston Bagpuze, scil. omnia. Messag, ter. & tenementa quonda Kingstons & Cliffs, ter. in Kingston Bagpuze, Prdict. nup. Quilters, tent. de Domina Regin. ut de Honore su. Leicestens, in soccag▪ per fidelit. & An. Reddit. unius Rose Rubie & vasor, per An. 10. 19.

These Lordships, with all the Appurtenan∣ces in the Parishes of Fifeild, and Netherton, with Newbridge, Gange, the Hams on the Ri∣ver Thames, a large Royalty of Fishing, and a
Swannery (as appears by Records) seem by the Purchase Deeds, to have been of great Ex∣tent, and continu'd in the Family of Latton 128 Years before they removed into Surrey.

It likewise appears, by the Writings before cited, that of old they have had large Possessi∣ons also in the Counties hereafter specify'd, viz.
Oxfordshire,
Glocestershire,
Hampshire,
Devon,
Dorset,
Somerset,
Essex,
Middlesex,
Kent,
Norfolk,
Suffolk, and
Surrey.
The Descent of the Family stands thus stated in the Heralds Office, excepting only the first, for which see Dugdale's Monsticon.

LIST.ITEM: 3. John de Latton [Isabe] Son of Walter, 28 Ed. 1.
5. Will. de Latton [Joan] settl'd at Ʋpton in Berkshire, 18 Ed. 2. 1325.
10. William Latton of Upton, T. H. 6.
11. William Latton of Upton, T. E. 4.

DIV1.P: Of these 20 Generations 14 owe their Birth to this County, thro' a Tract of above 350 Years continuance therein; but how far▪ up∣ward the Wiltshire Line, with all the Matches and Alliances of the Family since, may be trac'd is deft to any future Historian of that County. I shall but hint in this Place, that from thence are descended not only the English ace, but also those of the Naa's, a Town, and an∣tient Barony in the County of Kildare, and Pro∣vince of Lempster in Ireland, who assert them∣selves to have been settled there from the Reign of King John, with which this of the English Descent seems to be concurrent, tho' through Distance, Time, and Usage, they now write their Name different.

June 1718. The Chief of this Family is now, Patrick Latin, Es{que} seated at Moris Town, in the said County, who in the Year 1700. mar∣ry'd Jane, Daughter of William Alcock, of Clogh, in the County of Wexford, Es{que} (some∣time of the City of Dublin) by Jane, Daugh∣ter of Bramber, of Lncashire, and by her hath two Sons and six Daughters, viz. John, George, Jane, Begnot, Latin, &c.

In the middle Ile of the Church of Blewbery, in Berkshire, stands a raised Monument, where∣on
on are the Figures cut in Brass, of a Man in Armor, on whose Surcoat are the Arms of Daunce, viz. Party per Pale, A. and O. a Fess unule. G. between Lyons Heads erased of the same. Also a Woman, on the Right Side of whose Surcoat, art the foresaid Arms, and on the left are quarter'd those of Latton, Percy, Est∣bury and Sycheville, and underneath the follow∣ing Epitaph.
DIV1.Q: Of your Christe pray for the ot of Alice Daunce, Daughter of THO. Latton, ent. late the of Sir John Daunce, But Councellor, and General unto out Soveraign Lord King Hen. He Eight who deceased the 27 th Day of Aug. in the Yere of our Lord God, 152. Our whole Go Iesu have Merci. Amen.
DIV1.P: Underneath are the Figures of 5 Sons and two Daughters, also two large Books chain'd to the Monument, viz.
At the Foot of this Tomb, on a Grave-stone, cut in Brass, is the Figure of a Man in Armor, between his two Wives, with this Inscription.
DIV1.Q: Here lyeth John Latton, late of Chilton, Es{que} ana Anne his Wife, which John Dyed the XXXith of May, in the Year of our Lord God, M.CCCCCX.LVII.
DIV1.P: Under which are the Figures of 6 Sons and 9 Daughters cut in Brass.
DIV1.Q: William, Thomas, Anthony, Iohn, Bat∣tholomew, Iohn, Alice, Eliz. Mary, Mar∣garet, Dorothy, Ftizwith, Iane, Susan, Anne.
DIV1.P: From another Grave-stone the Brass Plates are lost, but the Persons there interr'd were John Latton, of Chilton, Es{que} and Agnes his Wife, Daughter and Heir of John de Estbury, this Scrap only remaining, viz.
DIV1.Q: ................ Lady, and there doe their Offering, and say a Pater, whatever their Devotion shall be...........
DIV1.P: Over this Monument are the Coats of Lat∣ton, Estbury, Pery, and Sycheville plac'd singly, and in this Order, viz. Estbury in the 2d Place.
Also the Figure of a Man in Armor between his two Wives, under each of which are the Figures of two Sons and three Daughters, with the Coats of Latton, Percy, Estbury, Sycheville, quarterly.

In a Chapel, on the South Side of the Church at Kingstone Bagpuze, Berks, over a Vault of the Family of Latton, stands a rais'd Monument, over which, in the Glass Window, are quarter∣ly the Arms following.
1. Partyiper Pale A. & S. a Saltier engrail'd Ermins, and Ermin counterchang'd by the Name of Latton.
2. A. 3 Fusils in Fess, S. by the Name of Percy.
3. Ermin Cros Bows in Pale O. by the Name of Chivacher.
4. A. 3 Bends Wavy, S. by the Name of Estbury.
5. A. on a Saltier B. between 4 Griffins Heads, G. a Lion's Face between 4 Lozenges, O. by the Name of Alvard.

DIV2.HEAD: Crest.
DIV2.P: On a Wreath of his Collars a Hind's Head coup'd, Az. on her Neck 3 Roses, G. cotiz'd, Or, between two Hazel Branches prop. in allu∣sion to the Heiress of Alvard, whose Crest it was.
In the Hall Windows, &c. of the Manor House adjoining, are the forementioned Coats quarterly, and also those of the Heiresses fol∣lowing.
John Latton, of Kingston, Berks, Es{que} marry'd Dortby, eldest Daughter and Co-Heir of Oli∣ver Wellsborn, of East Hanny, Berks, Es{que} by his first Wife, T. H. 8.
G. a chief Cheque, G. & O. a Wivil Rampt. O. over all a Bend Ermin, Wellsborn.
S. a Fess Cheque O. & B. between 3 Goats Heads erased, A. Sydeley.
A. a Tower, O. between 3 Cups cover'd, B. Amcots.
Ermin, in a Canton, G. an Owl, A. Barton. A. a Chief imbattled, S. Pour.
Ermin, on a Bend, G, 3 Cheverons, O. Brewley.
A. a Fess, S. between 4 dexter Maines, G. Quatremaines.
A. on a Bend, G. 3 Martlets, O. Wing, Vert. G. Danvers.

DIV2.HEAD: Crest.
DIV2.P: On a Wreath of his Collars is an Indian Wo∣man naked down to the middle, coup. front∣ing with her Arms struting, incircled with a Glory of Peacock's Feathers proper.

Sir David Williams, Judge of the Common Pleas, T. Eliz. mention'd by Mr. Ashmole, was second Husband to this Co-Heiress, Dorothy Wellsborn, Relict of John Latton, Es{que} of this Place, who both lie bury'd in the Vault spe∣cify'd.

Martha, the other Co-Heiress, was Wife of William Blomer, Es{que} of Hatharp in Gloucester∣shire, as particularly mention'd in that Visitati∣on, and these two Sisters went away with the Inheritance of Margery, Daughter and Heir of Tho. Poure, Es{que} of Blechington in Oxfordshire.

This Family of Wellsborn, now quite extinct, deriv'd themselves from the Plantagenets, by Sym. Montfort, Earl of Leicester, who marry'd Elea∣nor, second Daughter of King John. He was slain, with his eldest Son Henry, at the Battle of Evisham, in the Reign of Hen. 3. 1265. Almaric the second Son, was a Monk, and afterwards fell valiantly in the Holy Wars. Symon and Guy' two more of his Sons, fled with their Mother into France, and Richard the 5th Son, remain'd in England conceal'd under the Name of Wells∣born, and gave rise to this Family here men∣tion'd, of which speaks Cambden.
This Sym. Montfort, the Earl, had an elder Brother nam'd Peter, whose Posterity dwindl'd into a spurious Line; this only, which chang'd its Name, continuing untainted, as reported by the Family.
John Latton, of Kingston, Berks, marry'd Ka∣therine, second Daughter, and Co-Heir of Sir Thomas Hamon, of Kent, Knt. 19 Jacob.

This was a triple Heiress, her Mother also being a Co-Heiress of Martin of Dorsetshire, who was a Co-Heiress of Nicholas Wadham, Es{que}of Somersetshire, who founded the College of that Name in Oxford, in the Year of our Lord God, 1613.

DIV2.HEAD: Quarterings of Hamon.
DIV2.P: B. 3 Lions passant gard. issuant, O. two and one. Hamon.
B. 3 Roses, O. Cossington.
A. 2 Bends, S. Hartford.

DIV2.HEAD: Crest.
DIV2.P: On a Wreath of his Collars a Wolf's Head, erased, Party per Pale, O. and B.

The Manor of Turveys, alias Turreys, Lands in Rokeing, Bissington, Snave, Great Dotmere, Dykers, the Bullspots, Holton Green, New Church, Marcham, Morehorn, Ranels, part of the Manor of Tinton, purchas'd of Sir Peter Hayman. Houses in Castle Street, St. Margaret's in Canterbury, known by the Name of the Shoulder of Mutton, the Wal∣loons in Stower Street, St. Mildreds Canterbury, with all other Lands, &c. of Sir Tho. Hamon, in the County of Kent.

Per pale, A. and S. a Cheveron, G. and O. Lounders.

A. on a Fess, G. 3 Lions Heads between 10 Cross Croslects, O. 3 Lions Heads erased, A. Fa∣rington.

DIV2.P: A Martinet setting, G. collar'd and chain'd, O. also the Sun in its Glory.

B. a Lion Ramp. per pale▪ O. and G. Lory.
G. a Bend, Lozenge, Ermin. Read.

B. a Lion Rampt. O. Hendure.

A. on a Bend, S. 5 Beznts, O. Tregar.
A. on a Cheveron, G. 3 Fleur de Lis, O. Payner.

DIV2.HEAD: Crest.
DIV2.P: A Stag's Head coup'd, proper, with a Rose between the Hors, A.
In Devon, Dorset, and Somersetshire, were these Manors, Lands, &c. which descended from Nicholas Wadham, Es{que} viz.

LIST.HEAD: Manors and Lands not survey'd.
LIST.ITEM: Half the Manor of Ben∣sted Popham,
Messuages in Ash, Syke, Ede, Brownscomb,
Lands and Tenements in New Sarum,
Mediet. ter. in Southton and Whit-Lackington.

DIV2.P: To all which Estates (viz. of Wadham's, of Martin's, and of Hamon's,) Thomas Latton, of Kingston, Berks, with Strangeway's of Dorsetshire, and Windham of Somerset, became Part-Inhe∣ritor.
Escaetr. 19° Apr. 2° Eliz. N°. 68. Com. Suf∣folk, prout in Tur. London. & Capel, Rot. Scil.
Wilhel. Latton, Tenet. Manner. de Pistres, & Osmonds, de Wihel. Tenebry, de Maner. de Sutton & Woodhal, in Soc. Reddit. 13 s. 6d. per fidelit. val. 3 1.
Et Tent. mediet. 100 Acr. & Cent. Acr. Breuer in Suton, de Tho. Duc. de Norfolk, de Maner. de Covets. per servit, 4td. partis feod. milit. val. 20s.
Et Temnt. mediet. Maner. de Staverton Hall, de Regin. in. capit. per quod servit. ignor. 61. 13 s.

Et Tenet. Maner. de Broomberies, & mediet. vigint. Mess.& diversarum terrar. Act. & 4. Reddit. in Sutton, Reyndlesha, Eyke, Butley, Black∣sale, Orford, Wannesden, Hoo, Charsield, Hosketon, Bromfield, Ilford, Loudha', juxta Campessey, &c. de quo, t. per quod servit. ignor.
vl. 201. que facere cujusd. Tho. Alvard, Armig. Et Tenet. Manerium de Reyndlesha.
Ob. 25o. Dec. 1551. 5 Edw. 6. & Johan. Latton, est fil. & Her. Aetat. 2 An. 7 Mens. & 22 Die∣rum.

This Estate came chiefly by the Marriage of William Latton, of Chilton, Berks, Es{que} with Margaret, eldest Daughter, and Co-Heir of Tho. Alvard, of Ipswich, in Norfolk, Es{que} the rest being purchas'd by John Latton, of King∣ston Bakepuze, Es{que}
This Manor of Reyndlesha, before mention'd, was the antient Seat of Redvald and Swideline, Kings of the East Angles.

DIV1.HEAD: The last Will and Testament of Mrs. Anne Latton, one of the Daughters of John Latton, late of Chilton, in the County of Berks, Es{que} who departed this Life the...........
DIV1.P:
IN the Name of God Amen, The Sixth Day of November, 1584. and in the Twenty Sixth Year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lady Elizabeth, by the Grace of God Queen of England, France and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. I ANNE LATTON, one of the Daughters of John Latton, late of Chilton in the County of Berks, Es{que} deceas'd, being Sick in Body, but in good and perfect Remembrance (Thanks be given to God) do make and ordain this my last Will and Testament in Manner and Form
following; That is to say, renouncing, revo∣king, and annihilating first and foremost all for∣mer Wills heretofore by me made either by Word or Writing.

And principally, I bequeath my Soul to Al∣mighty God, my heavenly Father, surely and most stedfastly believing through the Merits of his dear Son's Passion only to be saved; and my Body I render to the Earth from whence it came, With a desire to be buried in the Parish Church of Blewbury, as near unto the Place (as may be) where my late Father lieth buried.

Item, My Mind and Will is, That my Fa∣ther's and Mother's Will and the Will, of my Brother Thomas Latton, be perform'd and ful∣fill'd to all Intents, and true Meaning, and in such Sort as any of us by Law, or Right, ought to have perform'd and fulfill'd, and by them or me, at the Hour of our Deaths, not done.

Item, That whereas my late Brother, Thomas Latton, deceased, did by his last Will and Te∣stament will me, being his Executrix, to lend unto the poor Occupiers of Abingdon, Newbury and Wantage; and to every of these Towns, Twenty Pounds a peice, upon sufficient Assu∣rance for the Payment thereof at the Year's end without any Gain, which now my Mind and Will is, shall continue and remain from Year to Year among them for ever; and for the which my Executors here under named shall take Bond for the repaying and lending there∣of, in Manner and Form as is declared in my said Brother's Will, and that they shall nomi∣nate and appoint those poor Occupiers who shall have same Money.

Item, I give to the poor Inhabitants of Wan∣tage Parish Twenty two Pounds of lawful Mo∣ney of England, to be deliver'd unto them with∣in five Years next after my decease, by the Dis∣cretion of my Executors. Furthermore, I give to the same poor Inhabitants Twenty Bushels of Wheat, and Twenty Bushels of Malt yearly, during the space of three Years next after my decease.
Item I give to the poor Inhabitants of Upton Tweny Shillings.
Item I give to the poor and needy Inhabi∣tants of Harwel Ten Pounds.
Item, I give and bequeath to the poor and needy Inhabitants of Chilton Ten Pounds.
Item I give to the poor and needy Inhabitants of both the Hagbornes Ten Pounds.
Item, I give to the poor and needy Inhabi∣tants of East Henred Ten Pounds.
Item, I give to the poor and needy Inhabi∣tants of East Illyslye Twenty Shillings.
Item, I give unto the poor and needy Inhabi∣tants of west Illyslye Twenty Shillings.

Item, I give to the poor and needy Inhabi∣tants of Blewbury Five Pounds of lawful Money of England. Also I will that these my Legacies lastly given unto the Towns and Parishes above written, shall be given and delivered by the Discretion of my Executors within Five Years after my decease.

Item, My Mind and Intent is, that my Exe∣cutors shall bestow One Hundred Smocks, or Two Hundred Ells of Canvas, of the Price of Ten Pence the Ell, unto, and upon One Hun∣dred
poor Women dwelling within the Villages and Parishes next abovesaid.

Item, My Mind and Will is, that my Execu∣tors shall bestow and distribute these my Lega∣cies next above given, upon some Friday, and Fridays, in their several Parish Churches of the Towns aforesaid, desiring them to give God Thanks for all his Benefits.
Item, My Mind and Will is, that my Execu∣tors shall give unto the poor People, and to those that shall resort unto my Burial Twenty Pounds of lawful Money of England.
Item, I give to the Repairing of Upton Church Twenty Shillings.
Item, I give to the Repairing of Blewbury Church Twenty Shillings.
Item, I give towards Repairing of Chilton Church Twenty Shillings: All which to be paid within five Years after my decease.
Item, I give towards the Mending of the Highways Ten Pounds, to be bestowed where my Executors shall think it most needful.
Item, I give unto Amys Lewndon, of Chilton, Ten pounds.
Item, I give unto Woodcock's Wife, of Reading, Ten Pounds.
Item, I give unto Wentworth's Wife, of Blew∣bury, Twenty Shillings, all which to be paid unto them within five Years next after my de∣ccase.
Item, I give unto every one of my Sisters, one Ring of Gold, and one Silver Spoon.

Item, I give unto Anne Legatte, my Sister's Daughter, Seven Pounds Ten Shillings of
lawful Money of England, to be paid within five Years next after my decease.
Item▪ I give and bequeath unto Walter Le∣gatte, my Sister's Son, Ten Pounds of lawful Money of England, to be paid within five Years next after my decease.

Item, I will and bequeath unto William Le∣gatte, John Legatte, and Bart boloew Legatte, my Sister's Sons Five Pounds a piece, to be paid within five Years next after my decease: And that if it happen any of them to depart this transitory Life before the Receipt of this my Legacy, then my Mind and will is, That the Part and Portion of him, or them so de∣ceased, shall be, and remain to, and among the other of them surviving.
Item, I give unto my Sister Alexander Ten Pounds of lawful Money of England.
Item, I give unto... her Daugh∣ter, Ten Pounds of lawful Money, to be paid within five Years after my decease.
Item, I give unto Michael her Son, five Pounds of like Money, to be paid within five Years after my decease.
Item, I give unto John her Son, Fifty Shil∣lings of like Money, to be paid within five Years after my decease.

Item, My Mind and Will is▪ that if it shall fortune my said Sister Alexander, or any of her said Children to depart this Life before the Re∣ceipt of their Legacies, then my Mind and will is, that the Part of him or them so deceased shall remain, and be equally divided to, and among the other of them surviving.
Item, I give unto Mary Castle Forty Shillings, to be paid within five Years after my decease.
Item, I give and bequeath unto John Wel∣beck, Thomas Welbeck, and Richard Welbeck, my Sister's Sons, Five Pounds a piece, to be paid unto them within five Years after my decease.

Item, I give unto the same Richard Welbeck an Iron bound Chest; also I give unto the same Richard the Lease and Term of Years of that Land in Henred which I bought of Ivering∣ham. Also I give unto the same Richard one Gelding.

Item, My Mind and Will is, that the same Richard Welbeck shall have, and receive Ten Pounds yearly, during the space of ten Years, to be paid out of the Farm of Wantage, the first Payment to begin the same Day twelve Month next after my decease. And that if it shall hap∣pen the said Ten Pound, or any Part thereof, to be behind, or unpaid, in the which that ought to be paid yearly, in Form as is aforesaid, my Mind and Will is, that then it shall, and may be lawful for the said Richard to enter into, and upon the Farm in Wantage, and from thence to take and carry away a sufficient Distress, and the same to Impound and Retain, until he be satisfied of his said Ten Pounds, and every part thereof, as often as it shall be so unpaid, being lawfully asked. Provided always, and my Will is, that if the said Richard Welbeck, or his Assigns, do any Prejudice or Harm in the Execution of this my last Will and Testament, in any manner of wise whatsoever, that then my Executors shall have and with-hold the same Ten Pounds so before given and bequeathed,
to their own proper Uses, in such Order and Form as the same was given and bequeathed by me unto the said Richard Welbeck, any Thing before mentioned to the contrary hereof in any wise notwithstanding.
Item, I give and bequeath unto Anne Welbeck one Diaper Clothe, six Napkins, one Towel, one Quilt.
Item, I give unto my Brother John Latton one Goblet of Silver.
Item, I give unto my Cousin John Latton, of Kingstone, one Silver Cup, and unto every one of his Children one Silver Spoon a piece.
Item, I give unto my Cousins George Tippinge, and Bartilmewe Tippinge, one Silver Spoon a piece.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Dorothy Wise∣an one Jewel, called the two Maidens.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Elizabeth Jen∣nings my Girdle studded with Gold.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Hide's Wife, of Sutton, one fine Sheet with three Leaves.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Anne Holloway on Diaper Clothe.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Seein's Son Ed∣ward Twenty Weather Sheep.

Item, I give unto Mary Pawling, my Sister Spier's Daughter, one Feather Bed furnished. And whereas her Husband oweth me 13 l. 6 s. 8 d. my Mind and Will is, that my Executors shall receive the same Money, and deliver him his Bond, and give the same unto the said Mary Spier's Children. Also I will, that my Execu∣tors shall give more unto her Children 10 l. to be equally divided among them.
Item, I give unto every of my Brother's and Sister's Children 10 s. a piece (excepting those which I have already, or shall remember with any Gift or Bequest in this my last Will and Te∣stament.
Item, I give unto every one of my God-Chil∣dren 10 s. a piece.

Item, I give unto Anne Pawling, the Daugh∣ter of Richard Pawling, and of Mary his Wife, one Furnace Pan; and that if she happen to depart this Life before the Receipt thereof, I will the same shall remain unto Richard Paw∣ling her Brother. And also I do further make this my last Will and Testament as touching and concerning the Order and Disposition of all my Lands, Tenements, Rents, Annuities, and of all my Farms and Leases, and all other Hereditaments within the Realm of England, in Manner and Form following (that is to say)

Item, I give and bequeath unto Richard Wel∣beck, being my Sister's Son, and unto Latton Welbeck, being my Cousin Leonard Welbeck's Son, and to their Heirs and Assigns, all my Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments in the County of Essex, unto the said Richard Welbeck, and Latton Welbeck, and to their Heirs and Assigns for ever.
item, I give unto my Servant William White Ten Weather Sheep, and to Richard Sheppard my Man 13 s. 4 d.
Item, I give unto Richard Tall Ten Weather Sheep and a Mourning Coat.

Item, I give and bequeath unto all the Residue of my Men Servants and Maid Servants, be∣ing in Covenant with me at the Time of my
decease, Twenty Weather Sheep a piece; and to every of them one Mourning Coat, and one Cow.

Item, I give unto Johane Shyppreve my Ser∣vant, one Crimson Cross, and one Christen∣ing Sheet, and all my whole Hay and wood at Henred, and Three Roother Beasts, and my Powter and Brass, and the one half of all my Houshold Stuff in Henred, excepting such there∣of, as shall be other wise disposed and given by this my last Will and Testament.
Item, I give unto her more, the first Crop of Hay at Lynsey yearly, coming and growing from our Lady Day, but no Lammas during two whole Years.
Item, I give unto her more, Twenty Pounds of lawful English Money.

Item, I will and bequeath unto my Servant Richard Knapp, after her two Years ended, shall have, and enjoy to him, and his Assigns, the whole Crop, and Ground of Linsey and Rochesey, with all Commodities and Appurte∣nances thereto belonging, and appertaining, yearly, and from time to time, unto the End, Expiration, and Determination of one Inden∣ture of Lease with one Arthur Hide, Gentle∣man, now hath and holdeth of me of the Farm of Wantage aforesaid.

Item, I will and bequeath that Johane Shyp∣prev, my said Servant, shall quietly and peace∣ably have, hold, possess, and enjoy my House and Lands at Henred, wherein I now dwell, with the Garden and Backsides to the same House belonging, for, and during the space of Seven whole Years next after my decease, keep∣ing,
the same House, Tenant-like, in all neces∣sary Reparations, and paying therefore Six Shillings yearly to my Executors, so that the same Johane shall not do any Act or Thing that shall be prejudicial and hurtful to the Executi∣on of this my last Will and Testament.

Item, My Mind and Will is, that my Execu∣tors shall appoint Twelve Men to carry my Body to the Church to be buried, and every of them to have Mourning Coat for his Pains; and further, I will that my Executors shall be∣stow Twenty Mourning Coats, or Gowns, upon such of my Kindred and Friends, as shall resort unto my Burial, to be given according to their good Discretions.

Item, I give and bequeath unto my well be∣loved Friend, Mr. Arthur Hide, of Hardwell, in the County of Berks, the one Half of my Lease and Farm of Wantage, alias Wantinge, in the said County of Berks, to have and to hold the same, one Half of the Manor or Farm of Wantage, unto the said Arthur Hide, his Heirs, Executors and Assigns, for, and during all such Term and Time as I have yet to come, and un∣expired in the same Indenture.

Item, I give unto my well beloved Servant Richard Knapp, and to his Heirs, Executors and Assigns, the other half Part and Portion of the said Lease and Farm, or Manor of Wantage aforesaid, to have and to hold the same half Part and Portion, with all, and singular the Appurtenances thereto belonging, to him and them during the Time and Term of Years to come, and to be determined in the same Inden∣ture of Lease mentioned.
Item, I will that Richard Knapp shall have the keeping of the Lease of the Farm of Wantage, till determination and end thereof, with all o∣ther of my Writings.
Item, I give and bequeath more unto the same Richard Knapp, one great Broad Chest in the Parlor in Henred; one great Brass Pot standing at Smith's in Chilton.
Item, I give unto him more Twenty Wea∣ther Sheep, one Cow, and one Mourning Coat.
Item, I give unto Johane Shyppreve my Ser∣vant, my Grey Nag.
Item, I give unto my Servant Elizabeth Shyp∣preve, one Feather Bed, and all Appurtenances thereto belonging.
Item, I give unto my Cousin Elizabeth Hearne my Woollen Apparel that I have used to wear; also I give unto her one Feather Bed, and all that belongs thereto.
Item, I will and bequeath unto her more, Twenty Pounds of lawful Money of England.
Item, I give unto Arthur Hearne, her Son, Twenty Weather Sheep.
Item, I give and bequeath unto John Hearne, Thomas Hearne, and the said Arthur Hearne, Five Pounds a piece, to be paid unto them when they severally shall attain to the Age of 21 Years.
Item, I give unto the said Elizabeth Hearne, my Cousin, Twenty Weathers.
Item, I give unto Agnes Freeman, of Upton, Five Quarters of Barley.

Item, I give unto those Women that have watched, and taken Pains about me in this my Sickness, 6 l. 13 s. 3 d. to be bestowed upon
them according to the Discretion of my Execu∣tors. But my Mind and Will is, that they shall be accompted none of them which I have alrea∣dy otherwise remembred in this my present last Will and Testament.
Item, I give unto the said Johane Shyppreve all, and singular, my wearing Linnen Apparel.

Item, I will and bequeath that Richard Tall and his Wife shall have Two Kine going in, and upon the Farm Grounds of Wantage, after the End and Term of Mr. Arthur Hide's Lease, first mentioned, until the Expiration of my O∣riginal Lease.

The Residue of all my Goods, Chattels, and other Things whatsover, as well moveable, as unmoveable, as also, all my Lands, Tene∣ments, Rents, Reversions, Remainders, An∣nuities, and all other Profits, Titles, Heredi∣taments whatsoever, not by these Presents gi∣ven nor bequeathed, devise, will, and be∣queath unto Arthur Hide, Gentleman, and to Richard Knapp, and to their Heirs, Executors, and Assigns, for ever, without Impeachment of Waste; which Arthur and Richard by these Presents I do make and ordain to be my full and whole Executors of this my present last Will and Testament. And whereas there is mortgag'd to me for Twenty Years, or there abouts, yet to come, the Fee Simple of certain House and Land, and other Hereditaments within the County of Berks, in East Henred, there my good Will, and special Meaning is (in Consideration they, the said Arthur Hide, and Richard Knapp, shall, and will take upon them the Execution of this my last Will and
Testament, and will truly and faithfully in the Fear of God perform the same accordingly, and according to the Trust and Confidence I repose in them, and in either of them, that they the said Arthur and Richard, shall have and enjoy all such Benefits, Profits, Commodities and Ad∣vantages, as in any manner of wise may, might, should or ought, or in time to come shall, and may accrue or redound to me, my Heirs or Assigns, by Reason of any such mort∣gaged Land (that is to say) the one Hals there∣of unto the said Arthur Hide, and to his Heirs and Assigns, and the other half Part and Porti∣on of the same unto the said Richard knapp, and to his Heirs and Assigns for ever.

And further, I do earnestly request, nomi∣nate and appoint, and make my trusty and well beloved Friend, Mr. Thomas Foorde, Doctor of the Civil Law, Hugh Hide, of Letcom, Gent. John Legatt, of Hornchurch Hall, Gent. Thomas Knapp, of Chilton, Edward Seenie, of London, and Francis Yates, of Lyford, Es{que} to be my O∣verseers of this my present last will and Testa∣ment; and I do give unto every of them for their Pains to be taken on this behalf, Ten Pounds a piece, besides all other charges and Expences which they, or any of them shall lay out, or expend in and about the necessary Af∣fairs, of this my present last Will and testa∣ment.

Provided always, that my true and faithful Meaning is, That if the said Arthur Hide and Richard Knapp, whom I have made my Execu∣tors, as before is mentioned, shall fortune to de∣part this World before the Probation of this my
last Will and Testament, or else shall refuse, and do not prove the same within Three Months next after my decease, that by Order and Course of the Law they may be thereunto admitted, and not restrained, or denied and kept from the true Ministring and Execution, and executing thereof, that then my Mind and Will is, That my Overseers above-named, or so many of them as will take upon him or them the said Executorship, by Virtue hereof shall have full Power and Authority to prove the same, my last will and Testament, whom also in this Case, by these Presents, I do make and ordain my Executor, or Executors, and I give unto him or them, or to such, or so many of them as shall take upon him or them the Probate and Execution of this my last Will and Testament, All such Legacies, Benefits, Commodities and advantages as I before have given, granted, and bequeathed unto the said Arthur Hide and Richard Knapp, by Virtue of their Executorship, and not otherwise, of any Lands, Tenements, Rents, annuities, Goods, Cattle and Chattles, As before is remembred, any Act, Statute, Pro∣vision, This present Will, or any other Thing or Ordinance to the contrary hereof in any wise notwithstanding. In witness whereof, I the said ANNE LATTON, have to this my present last Will and Testament put my Seal and Hand the Day and Year first above written. This present Testament, and last Will, was sealed, subscribed, and deliver'd by the Hands of Mi∣stress ANNE LATTON, to her Executors, the Day of the Date hereof, in the Presence of Hugh Hide, Robert Hutchens, and John Trewlock.

Memorandum, That the within named ANNE LATTON, the Two and Twentieth Day of No∣vember, in theAn. Dom. 1585. Twenty Seventh Year of the Queen's Majesty's Reign that now is, hath con∣fessed And affirmed before these Witnesses under written, that this present Will is her only last Will and Testament; and that if there be any Things by her granted, and unwritten in the same Will, she doth absolutely revoke the same to be none of her Will, except those Things which she doth deliver with her own Hands. By me,
Richard Welbeck, John Webb, and Lawrence Rushbrooke, and others.
